Job Description: Job responsibilities:•	As the General Manager of the division, you will be in-charge of building the business from start•	You will decide the best location(s) for retail stores, and hire the team to run the business •	You will partner with electronics distributors to bring in various brands and types of electronics, and negotiate the best price margins for the company•	You will hire a team sales and operations staff to run the day-to-day operations, 7 days a week, and achieve daily/weekly/monthly targets•	You will build a back-office team that will manage all inventory, purchasing, and finance aspects of the business•	You will recommend various systems and processes to ensure high employee productivity and efficiency, and the best possible service to customers•	You will work with the company’s microfinancing division to ensure customers can get financing for consumer electronics as fast as possible
Job Requirement: Job requirements:•	Preferably of Cambodian nationality, must be able to speak and write English and Khmer fluently•	Strong knowledge in the Cambodian electronics distribution business is a must•	Familiar with inventory management systems and tools•	Minimum 5 years working in import, distribution, or retail of consumer and household electronics•	Minimum 5 years in a leadership or managerial position, and managing a large team (at least 30 people)•	Able to operate with a fast-paced and start-up mentality; able to experiment various strategies, learn and adapt•	Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills and strong skillset in MS Office applications, especially MS Excel

Company Profile: Thriving in the Kingdom of Wonder, TPMG prides itself as Cambodia’s leading, one-stop premier property developer, transforming spaces and designing life. Our portfolio ranges from land acquisition to full-scale development, including residences, smart-technology integrated developments, and shopping malls. In response to ambitious expansion, TPMG is looking for highly qualified candidates to fill the following position/s. Please understand we are a property developer not a construction company. If you want to work for a company who values each employee and puts a high focus on employee engagement and support, then the TPMG group of companies is for you, apply now for a new step towards an amazing career with no boundaries. company_name: VUE ASTON (The Peninsula Capital Co., Ltd)
Job Description: 1.Managing all Online & Offline marketing and activities for the company.2.Developing the marketing strategy for the company.3.Familiar with Facebook/ Youtube background advertising operations, and have innovative, breakthrough thinking to improve the quality of advertising4.Regularly collect and update the latest market data of real estate and provide sales training5.Regular advertising adjustment and update plan6.Coordinating marketing campaigns with sales activities.7.Overseeing the company’s marketing budget.8.Creation and publication of all marketing material on line with marketing plans.Creating a wide range of different marketing materials.
Job Requirement: Fluent in spoken and written Khmer and English (Chinese a plus)Strong analytical and project management skills.Confident and dynamic personality.Able to manage and work within a teamInitiative, flexible and good interpersonal skillsStrong creative outlook.
Company Profile:
The Peninsula Capital Co., Ltd. is Cambodia's leading real estate developer and wealth management service provider.

The company has been profoundly engaged with the Cambodian real estate market for 15 years. The team members have got years of experience in large-scale land development and real estate projects in both China and Southeast Asia.

With continuous accumulation, the company has obtained a business model that consists of asset management, hotel operation, education, trading, media and cultural transmission all together inside the form of real estate development.

The Peninsula Capital Co., Ltd. currently has six branches in Cambodia and over 20 offices in China (including associates and strategic partners).
Contact Info: Contact Information Human Resource Department  012871694 (Telegram) & 093871694 sambath.leng@vueaston.com Phnom Penh No. 88 National Assembly Street,Sangkat Tonle Bassac,Khan Chamkarmon, Phnom Penh. 012871694 (Telegram) & 093871694

position: Math and Science in English Teacher
Job Description: P&D Tutoring Service Co.,LTD is The first leading Tutoring Service Company in Cambodia and the only one Tutoring Company that has registered the Business License from Ministry of Commerce. Now we are now seeking for plenty  of teachers such as Math, Physics and Chemistry in English who appropriate with below duties:- Can teach at students' home - No need to prepare lesson plan- Can be possible any times from 6am till 8pm (Urgently need 3 positions from 6pm to 8pm)- Can deal with any kind of students- Own transportation

-Both male and female

Company Profile:
Amret (https://www.amret.com.kh) is a leading microfinance institution established in 1991 that contributes to the economic and social development of Cambodia by providing a wide range of financial services to meet the needs of the large targeted customers. Amret has strong commitment and long-term business strategies to be a leading financial institution in the market by deploying ambitious digital strategies. 

Amret belongs to the Advans international group (www.advansgroup.com) a major shareholder and international shareholder (FMO and IFC). The Advans group serves over 750,000 clients, and has expanded its operations in nine countries such as Cambodia, Cameroon, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ghana, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tunisia. 

Amret has more than 150 branches, located in 25 cities and provinces in Cambodia, and successfully serves 450,000 customers with around 4,000 highly dedicated employees.

Job Description:
** Translation/Interpretation
• Provide the verbal interpretation services of 3 languages (Vietnamese – English – Khmer) in the production operation and as well as in other occasion as require by the manager and the company.
• Provide the written translation between the 3 languages in the production operation and as well as in other occasion as require by the manager and the company.
• Acting as Vietnamese-Khmer Interpreter in the absent of the incumbents
• Provide support to new hire Vietnamese interpreter(s) if needed on the technical words

** Administration
• Support Vietnamese staffs and production manager on booking air ticket, bus, transportation, and other logistics which may require from time to time.
• Administer the request of stationary/supplies such as pens, notebooks, hairnets, pencils, markers, papers …etc. for the production department and issue, up on approval, as requires. Also ensure there are enough stocks to supply and support the production.
• Support in ensuring the safety and first aid kid available all the times in production, refill the medicine and other medical materials as require and report to safety officer or management team immediately if there is accident happen in production.
• Facilitate the requesting and issuing of staffs uniforms
• Managing the production tools issuing to trainees
• Facilitate the leave application forms of all production staffs to manager and HR dept. for approval
• Facilitate the resigning and exit clearing people/documents/equipment.
• Preparing the overtime work documentations

** Other support
• Other clerical works as assign by manager
Job Requirement:
The successful candidate must have the following experience
• Fluent in English, Vietnamese and Cambodia both verbal and written
• Ability to translate between 3 languages
• Ability to maintain absolute confidentiality at all times
• Experienced in secretarial or administration duties
• Excellen spoken in Vietnamese and English.
• A high level of computer literacy.

** Working Days: 5 days per week (MON-FRI)
** Other benefits:
- Breakfast and Lunch is provided free
- Holiday Bonus
- Insurance (NSSF and FORTE 24/24)
- Annual basic increment
- Opportunity to grow

** Salary Range
- Negotiable (Upon experiences)
- If possible, mention the expect salary in the application

•  Sponsor extracurricular activities such as clubs, student organizations, and academic contests
•  Select, store, order, issue, and inventory classroom equipment, materials, and supplies
•  Enforces regulations concerning student conduct and discipline
•  Prepare students for later grades or levels by encouraging them to explore learning opportunities and to persevere with challenging tasks
•  Assign and grade class work and homework
•  Establish clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects, and communicate those objectives to students
•  Instruct students individually and in groups, using various teaching methods such as lectures, discussions, and demonstrations.
•  Prepare materials and classrooms for class activities.
•  Observe and evaluate students' performance, behavior, social development, and physical health
•  Perform other tasks assigned by upper manager

job title: Customer Service Officer /បុគ្គលិកសេវាកម្មអតិថិជន
position: Customer Service Officer /បុគ្គលិកសេវាកម្មអតិថិជន
Job Description: បុគ្គលិកសេវាកម្មអតិថិជន ត្រូវមានទំនាក់ទំនងល្អ និងដោះស្រាយរាល់បញ្ហាជូនអតិថិជន  ព្រមទាំងបង្កើនចំនូលជូនក្រុមហ៊ុនតាមរយៈ ការជំរុញអោយអតិថិជនចូលរួមបង់ថ្លៃសេវាថែទាំបុរីអោយបានគ្រប់ៗគ្នា ។
Job Requirement:
1	ទំនាក់ទំនងទារប្រាក់ថ្លៃសេវាពីអតិថិជន តាមរយៈការផ្ញើសារ ការចុះជួបផ្ទាល់ តាមរយៈការCall និងបិទប្រកាសផ្សេងៗ							
2	ទទួលប្រាក់ចំនូលផ្សេងៗ និងប្រាក់ថ្លៃសេវាថែទាំបុរី							
3	ទទួលដោះស្រាយនិងសម្របសម្រួលបញ្ហាជូនដល់អតិថិជន							
4	ចុះត្រួតពិនិត្យ និងរៀបចំសោភណ្ឌភាព អនាម័យ និងសណ្តាប់ធ្នាប់ម្ចាស់គេហដ្ឋានរស់នៅក្នុងបុរី							
5	ប្រគល់លិខិតបច្ចុប្បន្នភាព និងឯកសារបង់ពន្ធអចលនទ្រព្យប្រចាំឆ្នាំជូនដល់ម្ចាស់គេហដ្ឋាន							
6	ទទួលសំណើ និងចេញលិខិតអនុញ្ញាត្តិជូនដល់អតិថិជនក្នុងការស្នើសុំធ្វើការងារថែមថយ							
7	ទទួលសំណើ និងរៀបចំលិខិតអនុញ្ញាត្តិជូនដល់ថ្នាក់ដឹកនាំក្នុងការសម្រេចទៅលើការងារធ្វើការងារថែមថយ ខុសស្តង់ដារ							
8	រៀបចំចេញឯកសារគោលការណ៍ និតិវីធីការសាងសង់បន្ថែម និងទទួលកក់ប្រាក់តម្កល់របស់អ្នកម៉ៅការក្នុងបុរី							
9	រៀបចំចេញលិខិតអនុញ្ញាតិ្តជូនអតិថិជនស្នើសុំ ការថត Video រឺការស្នើសុំចែកខិតបណ្ណ័ផ្សេង							
10	រៀបចំចេញវិក័យបត្របង់ប្រាក់ថ្លៃសេវា និងសេចក្តីជូនដំណឹងផ្សេងៗជូនដល់អតិថិជន

Job Description:
Position Objective
Branch Manager is tasked with planning, People, Service/Performance, Marketing Strategy of the company.

Planning
• Strategy
• Prepare Action plan for Management and HOO
• Prepare Budget plan for Management and HOO

People
• Ensure that training standards are fully maintained so that future manpower requirements are covered.
• Operate staff performance appraisal systems and ensure action taken on results.
• To establish the levels of staff required to achieve the established budgets.
• In consultation with training personnel establish training needs, plan programmed and maintain records of training.  Ensure up-to-date and accurate documentation to allow grant redemption.
• Review staff’s attendant and request incentive of achievement for service and workshop staffs. 

Service & Performance
• Propose appropriated to purchase stock, consumables, short-life tools and other service-related products.
• Dailly Control and Prepare Processes of Operation (SOP)
• Tracking on Quality of service providing to customer
• Review with Head of Operation all sectional activities and reporting systems.
• Check the activities in the service and workshop, inspect completed work for compliance with safety and other statutory regulations.
• Monitor workshop productive performance daily, by total and individual technician/mechanic.
• Monitor Service performance revenue daily.
• Establish adequate safety and security procedures to protect property and company personnel.
• Check all workshop equipment for condition and accuracy of diagnosis.
• Ensure adequate maintenance of tools, equipment and other materials in the Branch.

Marketing
• Draw up and initiate service marketing plans.
• Instigate and operate advertising and promotional activities.
• In collaboration with Sales Department, establish system and method of ensuring all vehicle owners are introduced to Service Department and key personnel.
• Maintain record of customer complaints and/or congratulations for use and action as required.
Job Requirement:
• Knowledge and experience with automotive industry
• Ability to control clerical work, administration, organization, systems and financial matters, leadership ability
• Up-to-date knowledge of vehicle legislation, consumer legislation and trade practices
• Skills, experience and knowledge of modern business methods and financial control
• Good with English languages
• Have ability to work under pressure and deadline

Job Description:
Position Objective
Service Advisor is tasked with Service customer satisfaction /Performance and Up selling service/Repair.

Service & Performance
• To ensure customer awareness of all products and services available.
• To sell additional products, services and repair work in a professional manner.
• To carry out promotional work as directed and with enthusiasm.
• To provide customer estimates according to company policy on schedules, times and pricing.
• Dailly implement the Processes of Operation (SOP)
• Tracking on Quality of service providing to customer
• Review with branch manager all sectional activities and reporting systems.
• To initiate job documentation and maintain customer records and follow-up systems.
• No credit note authority.
• Credit facilities to be granted to customers who have prior approval from the Accounts Department and within the prescribed limits only.
• Warranty repairs to be authorized after inspection, or by agreement, in accordance with company policy.
• To ensure all customer and vehicle details are forwarded to the appropriate departments as necessary.
• To ensure customers are advised of all work carried out and of any further or future requirements the vehicle may have for repair or service.
Job Requirement:
• Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with customers and other staff members.
• Ability to accurately record all relevant information.
• Ability to receive payment for work carried out, accurately and precisely.
• Up-to-date knowledge of warranty procedures and documentation.
• Up-to-date knowledge, where appropriate, of computerized recording procedures.
• Ability to handle upset customers effectively.
• Training in telephone answering techniques.
• Technical qualifications an added advantage.

Job Description: •	Ensures safe working in mechanical maintenance (is accountable).•	Ensures mechanical maintenance delivers on time in full (OTIF) and with the required quality •	Leads the mechanical maintenance according to Planned Maintenance Program.•	Drives asset performance and manages, monitors and analyses the maintenance costs.•	Responsible for Effectiveness of breakdown support teams (MTTR).•	Informs plant manager of major breakdowns.•	Responsible for the maintenance RCFA process.•	Hands over project deliverables to PM teams (troubleshooting guides).•	Defines and trains BDA, MSA (minor stops analysis), RCFA (5 why) methodology.•	Ensures warranties process is followed•	Approves procurement of parts and services (mechanical)•	Supports strategic supplier management and evaluation.•	Establish and execute the Long (3YP) and medium (annual overhauls) maintenance master plan.•	Supports and improves Predictive Maintenance.•	Accountable for performance and technical development (incl. performance reviews) of entire mechanical maintenance organization.•	Manages workforce and capacity in mechanical maintenance, including training and out/in sourcing.•	Aligns planned maintenance stoppage with production stakeholders i.e. brewing and packaging managers (and reports to Engineering manager/ Plant manager).•	Accountable for all interfaces within maintenance and between the maintenance department and other departments within the brewery.•	Represents Maintenance in the Production Meetings.•	Defines and drives the maintenance strategy; i.e. installing required foundation organization, setting up the strategic maintenance plan, establishing basic standards, restoring all equipment to basic condition •	Establishes the functional competency of the mechanical maintenance (and operations) team in the use of basic maintenance systems and tools.•	Implements the management system and ensures the SAP or other CMMS in functional and in place•	Governs asset- and spare parts master data (is accountable).•	Monitors the maintenance KPI dashboard and uses this to report and control the maintenance department.
Job Requirement: •	Education: Minimum Bachelor, preferably MSc degree in Mechanical Engineering and/or similar.•	Experiences:  a.	>4 years management experience, preferably in a technical/operational surrounding.b.	Proven track record in people management (getting things done within a group/team).c.	Ambassador for enabling a safe and quality controlled working environment (leads by example). d.	Minimum of 4 years experiences & knowledge of maintenance (engineering) and/or operations, also from a strategic point of view: ability to setup and drive (strategic) improvement initiatives and manage changes from the shop floor within the department.e.	Enabler to effectively work together between different directly related departments (i.e. procurement, operations, finance).•	Skills: a.	Focused on and experienced in managing and controlling the 6 core work processes within maintenance; i.e. workflow (maintenance job life cycle) management, maintenance engineering, materials & parts supply, inventory management, asset master data management and cost management.b.	Ample working experience with CMMS i.e. SAP and others. Ability to support, manage and coach the ME (master data owner) in properly setting up the required master data structure and preventive maintenance regime within the SAP system. c.	Experienced in conducting BDA-analysis and training other BDA facilitators; i.e. good training skills.d.	Excellent communication-, management-, facilitation- and reporting skills. e.	Ability to effectively show/visualize the added value of maintenance (foundation) activities in relation to improving maintenance performance (can explain the required strategy to the team and other departments and create buy-in). f.	Ample knowledge of TPM and (other) continuous improvement methods.

job title: Senior Officer- Mobile Application Development (Phnom Penh)
position: Senior Officer- Mobile Application Development (Phnom Penh)
Job Description:
- Assist to develop and modify mobile application based on functional and system requirements, according to code standards and user interface design guidelines
- Perform program maintenance, modifications, and enhancements to existing applications through programming, testing, documenting, and training users
- Understand and execute the technical concepts and client requirements to ensure high quality technical solution
- Develop and design all in-house mobile applications upon the business requests
- Translate business requirements to technical documents in accordance with agreed templates
- Test software to ensure the code is correct, fixing ('debugging') errors where they occur, and rerunning and rechecking the program until it produces the correct results
- Write documentation for system references
- Ensure timely completion of deliverables
Job Requirement: - Bachelor’s degree in computer science- 2-year minimum experience in IOS/Android app development- Good designing and programming experience	 - Experience with Flutter is preferable - Knowledge of basic OOP and its essential factors- Familiar with some software architectures such as MVP, MVVM, VIPER, clean architecture or BLoC- Understanding large codebases, including API design techniques to help keep them clean and maintainable- Good communication skills- Attention to detail and accuracy- Flexible and adaptable in learning and understanding new technologies.

Job Description: • Sells products by maintaining and expanding customer base and managing staff.• Accomplishes regional sales staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees in assigned districts.• Communicates job expectations by planning, monitoring, appraising, and reviewing job contributions, and employee enforcing policies and procedures.• Plans and reviews compensation strategies.• Achieves regional sales operational objectives by contributing regional sales information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews.• Prepares and completes action plans and implements production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards.• Resolves problems, completes audits, identifies trends, determines regional sales system improvements, and implements change when necessary.• Meets regional sales objectives by forecasting requirements, preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions.• Establishes sales objectives by creating a sales plan and quota for districts in support of national objectives.• Maintains and expands customer base by counseling district sales representatives, building and maintaining rapport with key customers, and identifying new customer opportunities.• Recommends product lines by identifying new product opportunities or product, packaging, and service changes, surveying consumer needs and trends, and tracking competitors.• Other tasks assign by manager.
